賣.definition: to sell; to betray; to spare no effort; to show off or flaunt

賣乖.definition: to show off one's cleverness; (of sb who has received beneficial treatment) to profess to have been hard done by

賣傻.definition: to play stupid; to act like an idiot

賣光了.definition: to be sold out; to be out of stock

賣出.definition: to sell; to reach (a price in an auction)

賣力.definition: to work hard; to do one's very best; to throw oneself into the task at hand

賣力氣.definition: to make a living doing manual labor; to give sth all one's got

賣卜.definition: to do trade as a fortune teller

賣命.definition: to work tirelessly; to give one's all; to slave away; to throw away one's life; to sacrifice oneself (usu. for an unworthy cause)

賣官.definition: to grant government positions in exchange for bribes

賣官鬻爵.definition: (idiom) to grant government positions or official titles in exchange for bribes

賣座.definition: (of a movie, show or restaurant) to attract customers; popular with the paying public; high-grossing; number of seats occupied (by moviegoers etc)

賣弄.definition: to show off; to make a display of

賣本事.definition: to flaunt a skill; to give display to one's ability; to show off a feat; to vaunt one's tricks

賣炭翁.definition: The Old Charcoal Seller, poem by Tang poet Bai Juyi 白居易[Bai2 Ju1 yi4]

賣破綻.definition: to feign an opening in order to hoodwink the opponent (in a fight, combat etc)

賣笑.definition: to work as a good-time girl; to prostitute oneself

賣肉.definition: to sell meat; (slang) to sell sex

賣苦力.definition: to make a hard living as unskilled laborer

賣身.definition: to prostitute oneself; to sell oneself into slavery

賣錢.definition: to make money by selling sth

賣關子.definition: (in storytelling) to keep listeners in suspense; (in general) to keep people on tenterhooks

賣關節.definition: to solicit a bribe; to accept a bribe

賣面子.definition: to show deference to sb by obliging them (or by obliging sb associated with them)

賣風流.definition: to exert flirtatious allure; to entice coquettishly
